intro: Potamoganos microcalyx, commonly known as the small-flowered water plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and aquatic environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves that are often submerged or floating, adapted to aquatic conditions. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its roots are fibrous and help stabilize the sediment in shallow water bodies. Potamoganos microcalyx plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various water organisms.
